How are you on dates? What
happened in that year which has
affected this nation and in fact
the entire world7


Don't be hasty, dear reader.
No doubt you Immediately thought
of the beginning of World War
One in Europe. You are wrong.
You are right but the event which
l believe had more influence on
our lives today was the issuing Of
a patent for the first animated
motion pictures on August IL,
1914


A man mreme mbered and un-
heralded by modern movie mo-
guls was John Randolph Bray Of
New York. He gave movement
to cartoons of dog, the first
movie was simply entitled, 1.-The
Dachshund'


There was no story and no
historic action. 1t was simply
film of Mr.. Bray sketching the
wiener shaped canine.


Tuesday marked the fiftieth
anniversary Of this new picture
technique. There have been thou
sands of films made since the
first one, however, we have not
produced too much more as far
as subject material.


Dogs, cats, bears, gorillas.
and all kinds of animals have
near monopoly on the home and
theater screens. Animal car
toonists are todays nouveau rich
in the realm of moneymakers
from the reel and protector.


Even the first maker Of the
animated cartoon had more AMI
NAL attachments, his very name
BRAY, denotes the sound Of
a donkey.


Filmgoers and television view
ers have worried about the de-
mise of Gable, Bogart, Monroe,
Harlow, Greenstreet, w. c.
Fields, and LORE. We have
become accustomed to new stars
and starlets with humdrum names
as Tippi, Tuesday, Rip, Nick,
jill and Susan Qet us not overlook
Hayley).


Still holding on with tenacious
grip is Lassie, and Tarzan's
chimpanzees. They have been
joined by various Disney dogs
and Mister Ed, the talking horse.


A sure way to discover just
how great the impact of animals
has been--notice your next five
teleWsion commercials. Two Of
them will surely be selling dog or
cat chow. See how doggy or catty
the humans even act7


Tomorrow millionaire will
not be the person who makes the
better mousetrap but 1t will be
the man who trains the swing
INCEST mouse or develops the
next thriller starring a lovable
skunk.


The country is no longer
merely going to the dogs. The
dogs have won over and now we
are being ruled by the animal
kingdom from aardvark to ze-
